io.atomix.storage.buffer

Class UnsafeHeapBytes

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.storage.buffer.AbstractBytes
      • io.atomix.storage.buffer.UnsafeHeapBytes
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bytes, BytesInput<Bytes>, BytesOutput<Bytes>, AutoCloseable

    public class UnsafeHeapBytes
extends AbstractBytes
    Java heap bytes.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.atomix.storage.buffer.Bytes

    • Method Detail

      • allocate

        public static UnsafeHeapBytes allocate(int size)
        Allocates a new heap byte array.

        When the array is constructed, HeapMemoryAllocator will be used to allocate count bytes on the Java heap.

        Parameters:
        size - The count of the buffer to allocate (in bytes).
        Returns:
        The heap buffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If count is greater than the maximum allowed count for an array on the Java heap - Integer.MAX_VALUE - 5

      • wrap

        public static UnsafeHeapBytes wrap(byte[] bytes)
        Wraps the given bytes in a UnsafeHeapBytes object.

        The returned Bytes object will be backed by a HeapMemory instance that wraps the given byte array. The Bytes.size() will be equivalent to the provided by array length.

        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to wrap.

      • copy

        public UnsafeHeapBytes copy()
        Copies the bytes to a new byte array.
        Returns:
        A new UnsafeHeapBytes instance backed by a copy of this instance's array.

      • hasArray

        public boolean hasArray()
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Returns whether the bytes has an array.
        Returns:
        Whether the bytes has an underlying array.

      • reset

        public UnsafeHeapBytes reset(byte[] array)
        Resets the heap byte array.
        Parameters:
        array - The internal byte array.
        Returns:
        The heap bytes.

      • size

        public int size()
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Returns the count of the bytes.
        Returns:
        The count of the bytes.

      • resize

        public Bytes resize(int newSize)
        Description copied from interface: Bytes
        Resizes the bytes.

        When the bytes are resized, underlying memory addresses in copies of this instance may no longer be valid. Additionally, if the newSize is smaller than the current count then some data may be lost during the resize. Use with caution.

        Parameters:
        newSize - The count to which to resize this instance.
        Returns:
        The resized bytes.

      • zero

        public Bytes zero()
        Description copied from interface: BytesOutput
        Zeros out all bytes in the array.
        Returns:
        The written bytes.
